name: Anthropology of Language and Media
description: Anthropology studies language and media in ways that show the impact of cultural context. This course introduces this approach and also considers the role of language and media with respect to intersecting themes: ritual, religion, gender, race/ethnicity, power, nationalism, and globalization. Class assignments deal with lectures, readings, and students' examples. Same as ANTC59H3
prerequisites: [ANTB19H3 and ANTB20H3] or [MDSA01H3 and MDSB05H3 and ACMB01H3]
